metadata.title: CVE-2023-32784 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In KeePass 2.x before 2.54, it is possible to recover the cleartext masterpassword from a memory dump, even when a workspace is locked or no longerrunning. The memory dump can be a KeePass process dump, swap file(pagefile.sys), hibernation file (hiberfil.sys), or RAM dump of the entiresystem. The first character cannot be recovered. In 2.54, there isdifferent API usage and/or random string insertion for mitigation.

criterions.comment: keepass2 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
